availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Bridgeford (Fayette County, Kentucky, resident. Penitentiary inmate.)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Convicted of forgery in the Fayette Circuit Court in 1859. Inmate at the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort, Kentucky, from March 8, 1859, to February 23, 1861. Pardoned by Governor Beriah Magoffin on February 23, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 281.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 128A.
KYR-0001-020-0771.
